intro: Chirita macrodonta, commonly known as the large-flowered chirita, is a species of flowering plant in the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight to flourish. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in botanical gardens.
